official-title.#text: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to provide for the conduct of annual evaluations of mental health care and suicide prevention programs of the Department of Veterans Affairs, to require a pilot program on loan repayment for psychiatrists who agree to serve in the Veterans Health Administration of the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives December 9, 2014.

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Clay Hunt Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Clay Hunt Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act

header.#text: Evaluations of mental health care and suicide prevention programs of Department of Veterans Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide for the conduct of an evaluation of the mental health care and suicide prevention programs carried out under the laws administered by the

text.#text: Not less frequently than once each year, the
Each evaluation conducted under paragraph (1) shall—
use metrics that are common among and useful for practitioners in the field of mental health care and suicide prevention;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , including such programs conducted at a Center of Excellence;

text.#text: identify the most effective mental health care and suicide prevention programs conducted by the
identify the cost-effectiveness of each program identified under subparagraph (B);
measure the satisfaction of patients with respect to the care provided under each such program; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
Department of Health and Human Services

text.#text: propose best practices for caring for individuals who suffer from mental health disorders or are at risk of suicide, including such practices conducted or suggested by other departments or agencies of the Federal Government, including the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . Such third party shall submit to the
each such evaluation.

text.#text: Each evaluation conducted under paragraph (1) shall be conducted by an independent third party unaffiliated with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to the
and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report that contains the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives

text.#text: Not later than December 1 of each year, beginning in 2015, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: under subsection (a)(3) that the
has not previously submitted to such Committees.

text.#text: The most recent evaluations submitted to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: considers appropriate.

text.#text: Any recommendations the

header.#text: Publication of Internet website to provide information regarding mental health care services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to publish the Internet websites of the
, the

shall survey the existing Internet websites and information resources of the Department to publish an Internet website that serves as a centralized source to provide veterans with information regarding all of the mental health care services provided by the

text.#text: Using funds made available to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ), and community-based outpatient center in the Veterans Integrated Service Network—

text.#text: The Internet website published under subsection (a) shall provide to veterans information regarding all of the mental health care services available in the Veteran Integrated Service Network that the veteran is seeking such services, including, with respect to each medical center, Vet Center (as defined in
the name and contact information of each social work office;
the name and contact information of each mental health clinic;
a list of appropriate staff; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines appropriate.

text.#text: any other information the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall ensure that the information described in subsection (b) that is published on the Internet website under subsection (a) is updated not less than once every 90 days.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall ensure that the outreach conducted under
, includes information regarding the Internet website published under subsection (a).

text.#text: In carrying out this section, the

header.#text: Pilot program for repayment of educational loans for certain psychiatrists of Veterans Health Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall carry out a pilot program to repay loans of individuals described in subsection (b) that—

text.#text: The
were used by such individuals to finance education relating to psychiatric medicine, including education leading to—
a degree of doctor of medicine; or
a degree of doctor of osteopathy; and
were obtained from any of the following:
A governmental entity.
A private financial institution.
A school.
Any other authorized entity as determined by the
Subject to paragraph (2), an individual eligible for participation in the pilot program is an individual who—
either—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; or
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Veterans Health Administration of the Department of Veterans Affairs

text.#text: is licensed or eligible for licensure to practice psychiatric medicine in the
is enrolled in the final year of a residency program leading to a specialty qualification in psychiatric medicine that is approved by the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , as determined by the

text.#text: demonstrates a commitment to a long-term career as a psychiatrist in the
An individual who is participating in any other program of the Federal Government that repays the educational loans of the individual is not eligible to participate in the pilot program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall select not less than 10 individuals described in subsection (b) to participate in the pilot program for each year in which the Secretary carries out the pilot program.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall enter into an agreement with each individual selected under subsection (c) in which such individual agrees to serve a period of 2 or more years of obligated service for the
in the field of psychiatric medicine, as determined by the

text.#text: The

Subject to paragraph (2), a loan repayment under this section may consist of payment of the principal, interest, and related expenses of a loan obtained by an individual who is participating in the pilot program for all educational expenses (including tuition, fees, books, and laboratory expenses) of such individual relating to education described in subsection (a)(1).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may pay not more than $30,000 in loan repayment on behalf of such individual.

text.#text: For each year of obligated service that an individual who is participating in the pilot program agrees to serve under subsection (d), the

An individual who participates in the pilot program and fails to satisfy the period of obligated service under subsection (d) shall be liable to the United States, in lieu of such obligated service, for the amount that has been paid or is payable to or on behalf of the individual under the pilot program, reduced by the proportion that the number of days served for completion of the period of obligated service bears to the total number of days in the period of obligated service of such individual.
Any amount of damages that the United States is entitled to recover under this subsection shall be paid to the United States not later than 1 year after the date of the breach of the agreement.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to the
and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on the pilot program.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives

text.#text: Not later than 2 years after the date on which the pilot program under subsection (a) commences, the
The report required by paragraph (1) shall include the following:
The number of individuals who participated in the pilot program, including the number of new hires.
The locations in which such individuals were employed by the Department, including how many such locations were rural or urban locations.
An assessment of the quality of the work performed by such individuals in the course of such employment, including the performance reviews of such individuals.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines is needed by the Department in the future.

text.#text: The number of psychiatrists the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to the
and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: an update to the report submitted under paragraph (1) and any recommendations that the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: considers appropriate.

text.#text: Not later than 90 days before the date on which the pilot program terminates under subsection (i), the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall prescribe regulations to carry out this section, including standards for qualified loans and authorized payees and other terms and conditions for the making of loan repayments.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: commences the pilot program.

text.#text: The authority to carry out the pilot program shall expire on the date that is 3 years after the date on which the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish a pilot program to assist veterans transitioning from serving on active duty and to improve the access of veterans to mental health services.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall carry out the pilot program under subsection (a) at not less than five Veterans Integrated Service Networks that have a large population of veterans who—

text.#text: The
served in the reserve components of the Armed Forces; or
are transitioning into communities with an established population of veterans after having recently separated from the Armed Forces.
The pilot program at each Veterans Integrated Service Network described in subsection (b) shall include the following:
A community oriented veteran peer support network, carried out in partnership with an appropriate entity with experience in peer support programs, that—
establishes peer support training guidelines;
develops a network of veteran peer support counselors to meet the demands of the communities in the Veterans Integrated Service Network;
conducts training of veteran peer support counselors;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in each such Veterans Integrated Service Network, has—

text.#text: with respect to one medical center selected by the
a designated peer support specialist who acts as a liaison to the community oriented veteran peer network; and
a certified mental health professional designated as the community oriented veteran peer network mentor; and
is readily available to veterans, including pursuant to the Veterans Integrated Service Network cooperating and working with State and local governments and appropriate entities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: pursuant to paragraph (1)(D) that—

text.#text: A community outreach team for each medical center selected by the
assists veterans transitioning into communities;
establishes a veteran transition advisory group to facilitate outreach activities;

includes the participation of appropriate community organizations, State and local governments, colleges and universities, chambers of commerce and other local business organizations, and organizations that provide legal aid or advice; and

coordinates with the Veterans Integrated Service Network regarding the Veterans Integrated Service Network carrying out an annual mental health summit to assess the status of veteran mental health care in the community and to develop new or innovative means to provide mental health services to veterans.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to the
and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on the pilot program. With respect to each Veterans Integrated Service Network described in subsection (b), the report shall include—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives

text.#text: Not later than 18 months after the date on which the pilot program under subsection (a) commences, the
a full description of the peer support model implemented under the pilot program, participation data, and data pertaining to past and current mental health related hospitalizations and fatalities;
recommendations on implementing peer support networks throughout the Department;
whether the mental health resources made available under the pilot program for members of the reserve components of the Armed Forces is effective; and
a full description of the activities and effectiveness of community outreach coordinating teams under the pilot program, including partnerships that have been established with appropriate entities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to the
and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: an update to the report submitted under paragraph (1).
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives

text.#text: Not later than 90 days before the date on which the pilot program terminates under subsection (e), the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to hire additional employees of the
to carry out the pilot program under subsection (a).

text.#text: This section may not be construed to authorize the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to carry out the pilot program under subsection (a) shall terminate on the date that is 3 years after the date on which the pilot program commences.

text.#text: The authority of the

header.#text: Collaboration on suicide prevention efforts between Department of Veterans Affairs and non-profit mental health organizations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may collaborate with non-profit mental health organizations to prevent suicide among veterans as follows:

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and non-profit mental health organizations.

text.#text: To improve the efficiency and effectiveness of suicide prevention efforts carried out by the
To assist non-profit mental health organizations with the suicide prevention efforts of such organizations through the use of the expertise of employees of the
To jointly carry out suicide prevention efforts.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and any non-profit mental health organization with which the Secretary is collaborating under such subsection shall exchange training sessions and best practices to help with the suicide prevention efforts of the Department and such organization.

text.#text: In carrying out any collaboration under subsection (a), the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall select within the Department a Director of Suicide Prevention Coordination to undertake any collaboration with non-profit mental health organizations under this section or any other provision of law.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended to read as follows:

header.#text: Additional period of eligibility for health care for certain veterans of combat service during certain periods of hostilities and war

text.#text: In the case of care for a veteran described in paragraph (1)(D), hospital care, medical services, and nursing home care may be provided under or by virtue of subsection (a)(2)(F) only during the following periods:

Except as provided by subparagraph (B), with respect to a veteran described in paragraph (1)(D) who is discharged or released from the active military, naval, or air service after January 27, 2003, the five-year period beginning on the date of such discharge or release.

With respect to a veteran described in paragraph (1)(D) who is discharged or released from the active military, naval, or air service after January 1, 2009, and before January 1, 2011, but did not enroll to receive such hospital care, medical services, or nursing home care pursuant to such paragraph during the five-year period described in subparagraph (A), the one-year period beginning on January 1, 2015.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: on or before such date, the three-year period beginning on January 27, 2008.

text.#text: With respect to a veteran described in paragraph (1)(D) who is discharged or released from the active military, naval, or air service on or before January 27, 2003, and did not enroll in the patient enrollment system under

No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this Act and the amendments made by this Act, and this Act and such amendments shall be carried out using amounts otherwise made available for such purposes.
